thread.title: Lauren_Mills published Lloyds to close 200 high street branches
thread.title_full: Lauren_Mills published Lloyds to close 200 high street branches

author: Lauren_Mills
title: Lauren_Mills published Lloyds to close 200 high street branches
text:
Lloyds to close 200 high street branches By Lauren_Mills | Posted: July 28, 2016 0 COMMENTS SHARES Lloyds to close 200 high street branches X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Lloyds Banking said it will close 200 high street branches and axe a further 3,000 jobs, despite soaring profits. 
The bank has around 20 branches in the city and county. It has already closed its branch in St Albans Road, as well as its cashpoints in Horsefair Street branch and Devonshire Square in Loughborough. 
Lloyds has not disclosed which branches are earmarked for closure in the latest cull. 
A spokesman for the banking giant said: "We don't have the specifics of where they will be." 
Lloyds, which was bailed out by the taxpayer during the financial crisis, reported pre-tax profits of Â£2.45 billion in the six months to June 30, more than double the sum achieved in the same period last year. 
Chief executive Antonio Horta-Osorio said the closures were a result of "evolving customer behaviours", with increasing numbers opting for online banking. 
The bank also blamed post-Brexit uncertainty and the likelihood of interest-rates staying low in the wake of the decision to leave the EU. 
Despite this, Mr Horta-Osorio emphasised that Lloyds was in a "strong position to withstand the uncertainty" created by the vote. 
Almost 10 per cent of Lloyds is still owned by the British taxpayer.
